channel.title: LIN+ and RIN+ Pin outs shorted?
channel.description: I've just soldered a 40 pin header to my core, and when I did a continuity check I noticed that RIN+ and LIN+ appear to be shorted together. It's not a solder link because the pins are not next to each other. Is this to be expected. Thanks for your help

item.title: LIN+ and RIN+ Pin outs shorted?
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Yes, this is to be expected. The line-in signals are AC coupled to LIN-/RIN-, while the line-in jack ground is AC coupled to both LIN+ and RIN+. If you want to feed a balanced signal into the ADC from your own circuitry, you need to cut a few traces on the circuit board, LIN+/RIN+ are joined at C46.
